error.signature: The CustomResourceDefinition is invalid: status.storedVersions: Invalid value: must have exactly one stored version

verdict.summary: CRD version conflict occurs when multiple operators try to manage the same CRD or when upgrading CRDs with incompatible stored versions.

dead_ends.action: Force-delete the CRD and recreate it
dead_ends.why_fails: Deleting a CRD deletes ALL custom resources of that type — catastrophic data loss
Two operators managing the same CRD will conflict and corrupt resources

workarounds.action: Migrate CRD stored versions before upgrading: update storedVersions in the CRD status
Ensure only one operator version manages each CRD — uninstall the old version first
workarounds.how: helm uninstall old-operator && helm install new-operator

leads_to.condition: when CRD version is removed but resources still reference it

preceded_by.condition: when applying manifests with unrecognized CRD apiVersion

frequently_confused_with.distinction: CRD conflict is about multiple versions or operators clashing, while crd-version-not-served is about accessing a deprecated API version
